page.title: List of students at South Park Elementary

rev.diff:
Line 383: Line 383:
=== Damien ===
=== Damien ===
â
[[Image:Damien (South Park).JPG|right|180px|thumb|Damien, from the [[Damien (South Park)|episode of the same name]].]]
 
'''Damien''' first appeared in the episode "[[Damien (South Park episode)|Damien]]". Damien is the son of [[Satan (South Park)|the devil]], and has risen to Earth to attend South Park Elementary. He is generally rejected by everyone in his class, apart from [[#Pip Pirrup|Pip]], who attempts to comfort him, and begin a friendship. Damien later takes advantage of this friendship by setting Pip on fire to impress [[Eric Cartman|Cartman]] and the other boys. At the end of the episode, Satan takes Damien back to Hell. Damien is shown to have fire in his eyes. The character was inspired by [[Damien Thorn]], the child [[antichrist]] character in the 1976 horror film ''[[The Omen]]''; the music which plays in "Damien" whenever he performs magic is also directly inspired by the music from that film. The cruel way in which Damien is treated by the other children when he first arrives at the school is inspired by Trey Parker's real-life experiences starting at a new school in the second grade.<ref>{{cite video | people=Trey Parker, Matt Stone|year=2003|title=South Park: The Complete First Season: "Damien"|format=Audio commentary |medium=CD||publisher=Comedy Central}}</ref>
'''Damien''' first appeared in the episode "[[Damien (South Park episode)|Damien]]". Damien is the son of [[Satan (South Park)|the devil]], and has risen to Earth to attend South Park Elementary. He is generally rejected by everyone in his class, apart from [[#Pip Pirrup|Pip]], who attempts to comfort him, and begin a friendship. Damien later takes advantage of this friendship by setting Pip on fire to impress [[Eric Cartman|Cartman]] and the other boys. At the end of the episode, Satan takes Damien back to Hell. Damien is shown to have fire in his eyes. The character was inspired by [[Damien Thorn]], the child [[antichrist]] character in the 1976 horror film ''[[The Omen]]''; the music which plays in "Damien" whenever he performs magic is also directly inspired by the music from that film. The cruel way in which Damien is treated by the other children when he first arrives at the school is inspired by Trey Parker's real-life experiences starting at a new school in the second grade.<ref>{{cite video | people=Trey Parker, Matt Stone|year=2003|title=South Park: The Complete First Season: "Damien"|format=Audio commentary |medium=CD||publisher=Comedy Central}}</ref>
